Test Case Name: Reset Password via Email Link (Online Banking)
Preconditions: User has a registered and verified email; password reset feature enabled; test environment can send emails.
Test Steps: 1. Navigate to the online banking login page. 2. Click Forgot Password. 3. Enter the registered email address. 4. Submit to receive a password reset link. 5. Open the received email and click the password reset link. 6. Enter a new strong password and confirm it. 7. Re-enter the new password to confirm. 8. Log in using the new password to verify access. 9. Sign out. 10. Optionally verify that password history is updated and account activity is logged.
Expected Result: Password is updated; user can log in with the new password; a reset email is sent; no sensitive data exposed.

Preconditions: User has a verified account with security questions set up.
Test Steps: 1. Go to the login page. 2. Click Forgot Password. 3. Enter account identifier. 4. Choose Security Questions option. 5. Answer the security questions correctly. 6. Create a new password that meets policy. 7. Confirm new password. 8. Log in with the new password to verify access.
Expected Result: Password is updated and user can log in using the new password; security questions flow works as intended.

Test Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Click Forgot Password. 3. Enter an unregistered email address. 4. Submit. 5. Observe the response. 6. If a standard message is shown, attempt to log in with the unregistered email to ensure no account is created.
Expected Result: The system shows a generic message indicating that an email may be sent without confirming account existence; no password reset occurs for unregistered emails.

Preconditions: User has a verified email and can receive reset emails.
Test Steps: 1. Start password reset for a registered account. 2. Open the password reset link soon after receiving email to test normal flow. 3. Reopen the same link after the token has expired (simulate waiting). 4. Observe expiry message and prompt to request a new link. 5. Request a new password reset link. 6. Open the new link and set a new password. 7. Log in with the new password.
Expected Result: Expired token message; user can request a new reset; after obtaining a new link, the user can reset the password and log in.

Test Steps: 1. On login page, click Forgot Password repeatedly within a short period (for example, 5 times in 1 hour). 2. Observe throttling or block after threshold. 3. Wait for cooldown period. 4. Retry password reset flow for the same account to confirm normal operation.
Expected Result: System enforces rate limits to prevent abuse; the user receives a generic throttling message and no account information is exposed; after cooldown, normal reset flow resumes.

Preconditions: User's mobile number is verified and capable of receiving SMS.
Test Steps: 1. Open the online banking login page. 2. Click Forgot Password. 3. Select the OTP via SMS option. 4. Enter the registered mobile number. 5. Receive OTP on the mobile device. 6. Enter the correct OTP. 7. Create a new password that meets the policy and confirm. 8. Log in using the new password to verify access.
Expected Result: Password is reset and login is successful; OTP verification ensures possession of the registered mobile number.

Preconditions: User account with password policy in place.
Test Steps: 1. Initiate password reset for the account. 2. Enter a weak password (for example, Password123). 3. Observe the policy guidance and prompt to strengthen the password. 4. Enter a strong password that meets policy. 5. Confirm and save. 6. Log in with the new password to verify access.
Expected Result: Weak passwords are rejected with guidance; a strong password is accepted; user can log in successfully.

Test Steps: 1. Initiate a password reset and check the reset email content. 2. Verify that the email contains only a reset link with a token and generic instructions. 3. Ensure the email does not reveal passwords or sensitive personal data. 4. Click the reset link from the email and set a new password. 5. Log in with the new password to verify flow.
Expected Result: Email content complies with privacy standards; no passwords or sensitive data are exposed; user can reset password and log in.
